content.question: An airplane’s height above sea level is modeled by the differentiable function <math alttext="y equals h of t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>h</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the number of minutes after takeoff and <math alttext="h of t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is measured in feet. The graph of <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is shown in the figure for <math alttext="0 less than or equal to t, less than or equal to 15" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>15</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Of the following, which is the best estimate of the rate at which the plane is rising above sea level, in feet per minute, at time <math alttext="t equals 9" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator 37,275 minus 150, and denominator 15 minus 0, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>37</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>275</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>150</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>15</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 37,275 minus 9,775, and denominator 15 minus 5, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>37</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>275</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>9</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>775</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>15</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 37,275 minus 16,859, and denominator 15 minus 7, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>37</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>275</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>16</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>859</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>15</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 30,763 minus 16,859, and denominator 11 minus 7, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>30</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>763</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>16</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>859</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>11</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator 30,763 minus 16,859, and denominator 11 minus 7, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>30</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>763</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>16</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>859</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>11</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 2.3: Estimating Derivatives of a Function at a Point

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
